subject: Technology
title: The Accelerometer in Your Pocket
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Accelerometer in Your Pocket usable.

hook.text: Tilt your phone and the screen rotates. Shake it and the undo dialog appears. Something inside is watching.

buildup.text: An accelerometer is a tiny chip that measures motion and orientation in three dimensions.

discovery.text: It works by detecting microscopic changes in the position of a tiny mass inside the sensor.

twist.text: Accelerometers were originally built for missiles and spacecraft. Now they cost pennies and fit on a fingertip.

climax.text: They power step counters, gaming controls, crash detection, and automatic screen rotation.

punchline.text: Missile guidance technology now counts your morning steps.

quiz.question: What does an accelerometer measure?
options: Motion and orientation in three dimensions
